item.value: The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.
Light travels slower through different substances such as glass, water and air.
The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
Roughly 70 percent of an adult's body is made up of water.
More than 1,000 different languages are spoken on the continent of Africa.
Electric eels can stun both predators and prey with electric shocks of around 500 volts.
Most people blink about 17,000 times a day.
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants. Los Angeles is in second place. It has 3.8 million people.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
The creator of the first working light bulb was Joseph Wilson Swan. Thomas Edison improved on Swan's design by using a better incandescent material and a higher vacuum.
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
China has the largest population of any country. It has over 1.3 billion people.
The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in northern and south-western China. English is the second most spoken language in the world.
The explosion of Mount Tambora in Indonesia in 1815 has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
The heaviest apple weighed 1.849 kg (4 lb 1 oz) and was grown and picked by Chisato Iwasaki at his apple farm in Hirosaki City, Japan October 24, 2005.
Alaska is the largest state in America.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. Known as the Great Chilean Earthquake, the quake measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
There are more than 2,700 languages in the world.
On April 30, 1789, George Washington became the first President of the United States.
